I hope the presets are just a placeholder. I prefer to customise my characters; I'll play regardless, I just like having a character that's uniquely my own (one of the reasons why I never really got very far in Witcher 3)Ôªø

I gotta be frank on this, relying completely on templates seems like a bit of a step back. Especially since other games like Fallout 3/New Vegas, Skyrim, and Dark Souls were able to use sliders and Fallout 4 had a full on sculpting feature. If they're presets to choose and then build off of, that would be a very different matter but when I heard that you could spend hours customizing your character, I was thinking the appearance would have a bit more depth to it. 

Of course there's all the other stuff. I do like being able to customize the character's backstory similar to Mass Effect. I do hope that's well fleshed out and offers a lot of interesting but diverse options for the sort of character one would want to play as. 

The clothing stuff seems alright. I do hope there's some good variation in clothing available. 

Concerning stats, I could have sworn that luck and empathy weren't stats in the video game. I believe Yong Yea said that.Ôªø

I'm curious how they will handle the nudity in the final version of the game. Outside of the US it's not a big deal having full nudity shown, but with this being on consoles I can definitely see them unfortunately toning the sexuality and removing full nudity. The ESRB     just won't allow it. Hoping for a PC alternative version where it's allowed.Ôªø

I can only reiterate that for me, having to choose a character class in Cyberpunk 2020 was part of the "attitude is everything" and "style over substance" ethos - it marked how your character looked at the world around him or her and how they chose to deal with problems. An open system allows to equivocate, that to me runs counter to some of the fundamental concepts of the game - go big or go home, make a decision and stick with it. These people have "special abilities" because that's who they are - highly talented specialists doing what they were born to do.Ôªø
